text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to explain that through the principle of direct effect, national courts have to apply EU law over domestic rules. The candidate answer mentions that national courts can apply EU law (Section 2: 'You can bring a case arguing the law/measure violates EU law'), and that they can refer questions to the CJEU via preliminary ruling (Art. 267 TFEU). However, it does not explicitly state or explain the principle of direct effect, which mandates that national courts must set aside conflicting domestic law in favor of EU law.", "criterion_id": "38ca85f5-5bc9-4df7-870e-06603d42d588"}
